meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a gonidium.
meanings.sent1: The green algae had a gonidial appearance under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the gonidial structures of the plant cells.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted a gonidial pattern on the canvas, creating a unique design.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a gonidial paradise, with various shades of green blending together.
meanings.sent5: The gonidial features of the leaf made it stand out among the others in the collection.

meanings.sent1: The pond water was filled with gonidial organisms, visible under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The gonidial cells were carefully examined for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The chef created a gonidial dish, incorporating various microscopic ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The forest floor was a gonidial carpet of tiny green plants.
meanings.sent5: The microscope revealed the intricate details of the gonidial structure within the sample.
